132408712.review:
Turbo Pug 3D is cheap garbage, but in 3 dimensions! (worse)

Why did they attempt 3d for this one? Who knows. The result is looking and controlling somehow significantly worse than the other Turbo Pug games. Oh, and because they don’t know how to optimize, it runs way worse too.

In pretty typical Turbo Pug fashion, there’s pretty much no variety in terms of level design. It just keeps repeating the same stuff over and over again in slightly different variations. This is a problem in the other Turbo Pug games of course, but it comes off as especially garbage in this one. I’m not sure if there’s literally less or because the presentation of it shows off how pathetic it is better or what, but it’s worse in this one.

On top of all of this, they had the gall to call the achievement that you get for unlocking the penguin “Friend from North” when we all CLEARLY know that penguins are Antarctic creatures, in the SOUTH.
THEY ALSO SPELL IT PINGUIN IN-GAME HOW DO YOU MESS THAT UP

Objective - 2/10;
Subjective - ANTARCTIC, NOT ARCTIC YOU FOOLS/10;

102574213.review:
I got this game as part of a dollar bundle years ago, and couldn't run it on my potato laptop back then. Now that I have a new gaming laptop in 2021, I was able to try out this game.. and well, I would say that it is an OK infinite-runner game with nice graphics and good music, but as other reviewers have noted, there IS jumping lag, and some of the obstacles are overtly difficult.

I saw on steamdb that the dev permanently lowered the price of this game to the lowest possible on Steam. However, that is not enough for me to recommend it. Just watch some gameplay on YouTube if you are super curious. Or if you REAAAAAAAALLY want to have this game, wait for it to go on sale.

P.S.: Every time you die, the camera goes slightly forward for 2-3 seconds before letting you try again, which only serves the purpose of [b]wasting the player's time[/b]. Dear dev(s): Take a page out of Hotline Miami, and let us try again immediately!

79181708.review:
2.5 / 5.0

A 3D version of the cult following runner game Turbo Pug. The game features an interesting sort of isometric view that allows you to see what's coming ahead in terms of obstacles. Soundtrack features songs from previous Turbo Pug games. You collect coins to unlock new skins/hats just like in previous games. This game lacks the unlockable letters and mini games that Turbo Pug DX has. 

There is a very weird weight and slight delay in the control and physics that makes the game not as precise as you would hope for a runner game. With that being said, you can get this for under a dollar so I'd say it's a thumbs up although if you absolutely have to choose one I'd recommend the 2D version of Turbo Pug DX for more features and bang for your buck.

78198125.review:
This "3D" game is just a worse version of Turbo Pug DX. It has some of the same flaws as that game, like sometimes a jump input not registering, but 3D has fewer characters, fewer level patterns (I think), and ittiming your jumps when playing in "3D". It also reuses music and sounds from the previous games.

The reason I put 3D in "" is because while the models might be 3D, the movement is purely two-dimensional, just like in the previous games.

This is a badly made low poly endless runner/joke game revolving around the theme that your character is a pug.  Inexplicably people led the developers to believe their first joke games were actually acceptable so they made more. 

If endless runner games (which you can play for free on mobile) had any real serious merit as video games, this one would still be considered a failure.  The controls are a complete mess, they're sloppy, and there's lag when you jump, which makes skill or timing near impossible to apply to this mess.

71344775.review:
There are any number of achievements reached by man in our short history. In the roughly 5,000 years of recorded writings, we trace our lineage to any number of accomplishments -- from the invention of the wheel to landing on the moon; from the advent of agriculture to the polio vaccine. But the path has not always been easy: the same progress we celebrate in these marvels of ingenuity has too often worked to the detriment of human beings. The same atomic energy that powers our electrical grid, for example, threatens our very existence; the extraordinary interconnectedness provided by the world wide web is used just as readily to spread messages of hate and division.

It is this paradox -- the tragic medley of brilliance and violence, of hope and chaos -- that lies at the heart of Turbo Pug 3D. For in the long catalogue of three-dimensional infinite run games, no other work comes closer to accomplishing the feeling of what it must be like to live as a pug in a sombrero, aimlessly running through deserts and fields. And yet, at the same time, the core goal of the game, to reach 1,000 points, is a feat unattainable by mortal beings.

It is for this reason that I must give this game a score less than the 10/10 some would argue it truly deserves. Yes, it is true that this game allows you to play not only as a pug, but also as a cat and a penguin -- and, yes, as some of you are surely thinking, it is just as true that this game allows players to collect coins in order to unlock a royal crown which can be worn by the game's protagonist. But it is also true -- and this is important -- that no player has every achieved more than 1,000 points in this game. That doing so simply cannot be done, and likely will never be done by human beings.

It is this sad fact, that 1,000+ points are unattainable in this game, that speaks to the aforementioned tragedy of human existence. This unattainable goal is representative of the broader tragedy of the human condition -- that we are born into a paradise, yes, but that is is fallen, as we are but mortal beings. That we live our lives like Sisyphus, forever carrying boulders up our respective hills, only for our burden to eventually fall back down. That our lives, however meaningful and however beautiful, must someday end. And, sadly, that no matter how many miles we attempt to run, our pug will forever slam into the wall of a low-poly voxel just short of 1,000 points.

In the words of Albert Camus, we must imagine Sisyphus to be happy. For to believe otherwise is to make life unliveable -- or worse, unworthy of us.

It is for this reason that I give Turbo Pug 3D an 8 out of 10.

EDIT: I got 1,000+ points and the corresponding achievement. 10/10.

55053431.review:
Autoscroll jump'n'run with minecraftish graphics and some unlockable skin stuff.

There's two things you wanna shoot for: coins for said skins and a score of 1.000. While first comes naturally, getting points beyond 400 is very much impossible for one simple reason: The race track is build in tiles, such as spikes, barrels, boxes, gaps and more. Every race is randomly generated with prefabricated tiles. Most of which need to be cleared by jumping over them. A jump however uses more than a tile, you are not landing in the same frame where you jumped. This causes you to undershoot multi-jumps in the beginning - expecting to barely make it with the final jump as the delay shifts your position with every jump a little more forward causing you to crash into the last obstacle very often. This could be keyboard and human input lag. Obviously you can't hit jump at the exact time the character is again able to perform a jump.

A single mistake ends the run. If I then check the leaderboard and see 8.000s and higher, that means, someone managed to play for 15.000 seconds straight without a single mistake, that's 250 minutes.

I also noticed that beginning with 350 points that I managed a few times new tiles are introduced so there is variation in longer lasting runs. Besides that one flaw it's a cute little title overall.

TURBO PUG 3D is a runner game featuring a tangling situation puppy named after a pug!!!A Cat and a penguin with nifty fancy wake-up call helmets to wear when u collect the rampaging coins while not getting hit by the multitasker badge of honor traps!!!

Cool thumpin soundtrack with melody twisted themes set in this minecraft world with a crafty engaging health crisis sun switching the lanes a bit with sunset light beams and sometimes a night chilly sky or maybe a snowy blizzard flapping the weather design all over the central place!!!

First of all what a fun game that is improved to extend more of your life if you really want to relax on the preconceptions around you!!!

The deep dragtastic truth with decadent effort!!!I say pick up this game its both relaxing and a challenging platformer runner based that u will hum the tunes as the dog sings along!

I give this game a 9.0/10 its worth it and i think the price is just right but a very short game if your not in for an arcade running along marathon race to the finish...Wait their isnt a finish why am i still going love the burrito master

44611971.review:
Holy crap.

Okay, read my review on Turbo Pug DX. 

https://store.steampowered.com/recommended/recommendgame/513780

Go ahead. I'll wait for you.

Done?

Yeah, this game is worse. I played it for literally two minutes and was repulsed by the gameplay. To write this review, I had to get the playtime up to 5 minutes. But it only took two to see this abysmal game for what it is.

First of all, the wait time between attempts is even longer now. It's like 5-6 seconds. That is a LOT of time when you're dealing rapid many-deaths twitch reaction gameplay. Imagine how infuriating it would be if I Wanna Be the Guy made you wait 5 seconds every time you hit R.

Second of all, you can't start a run with space any more. So not only do I have to wait 5+ seconds, but I have to move my hand over to the mouse and click a small area of the screen. Why?

Third of all, the control latency and hit detection are even worse, and not in the flappy bird way. It's just bad.

Fourth of all, this feels like an unfinished unity3d demo/prototype that somebody made in a couple hours (if not minutes).

Fifth of all, this game is "3D", yet there is no way to control the camera angle or really do ANYTHING with the third dimension. So actually, this game is 2D. You know what makes Yoshi's Story and Little Big Planet 2.5D? You can interact with the third dimension, but it's limited. E.g. in LBP you can jump between a few different "layers".

And they have the nerve to sell this game for money.

I'm starting to question if these games are just asset flips.

unless your name is O_SEBIN, go waste your money on something more productive like a fidget spinner or something.

42615976.review:
The word terrible can not even begin to describe this game, this is one of the downright worst games i have played. I assume i got this in some sort of bundle of games, because in what state of mind would you have to be in to purposely buy such a game. I guess the only positive is that i got it for much less than the actual price. Even though it is unbelievably cheap.

This game is another 'not for steam game'. Things like this don't belong on steam. It's something you would find in the app store for free, yet they are charging you for a pile of garbage that isn't even well optimised. I can not believe how such a game can get on to steam, along with the many other games they have in this 'franchise'. For someone to enjoy sitting playing this really baffles me.

I think my main hate towards this game is the difficulty, i love going for achievements in games and that was the main reason i decided to finally download it on the day of this review. However, i hate achievements that require you to be in the top band of players, now to people who enjoy this game and are thoroughly good at it, they may critcise this and just call me bad, and i can agree, i cant even get far with my score. But for something to kill you so easily and make it so obsticles are sometimes virtually impossible to jump over multple in quick succession, make it so that the 'Unstoppable' achievement of geting 1000 points is not accessable to a lot of players.

On top of this, the spacing between such obsticles is horrendous, when spamming my mouse, i can't even click quick enough to jump over the next obsticle. Whenever such come up, i have already lost. It isn't my reaction time either as there is one obsticle with three consecutive jumps, with spikes, and you have to be perfect to get over it.

To make things worse is the lack of optimisation for this game, the fact that such a shitty small game lags more than an online shooter ceases to amaze me, this makes it impossible to even attempt to get a high score as it just kills you whenever it wants, and for a game that relies solely on timing, it really hurts the gameplay.

In addition, just like the games prior to it, the music is awful, there are basically five songs, two of them calm and the rest fast. Only one of them fitting the tempo and tone of the game. To just place random songs is lazy once again, but i am glad that there are multiple songs so that it doesn't get repetetive like other games that last a while.

I noticed a lot of reviews saying this was a step up in the 'franchise' yet in my opinion, i think it is lazy. The graphics are terrible, simple and plain. Moreover, the game is much more difficult in 3D and works much better as a 2D game.

The sad thing is that at some point in the future i am going to have to return to this mess to attempt the achievement and i don't know if i can take that pain again. Overall the game is an excuse of a steam game, and is totally lazy in many ways, and i would really not recommend getting it.

I actually enjoyed this little game and I can't understand all the hate it gets. It's just a child friendly game with simple gameplay (but sometimes pretty hard difficulty).
There could be some small improvements, but the only things I could complain about is that playing as Penguin slows a little bit the game down and the music gets repetitive.
I've got over 3 hours of gameplay and received all the achievements, including the one for a 1,000 highscore. Probably I would've played it even more if it had more collectables, but I'll sure start a new game every now-and-then.

I recommend this game, maybe not on full price, but at least on sale. I myself will buy the 2D version very soon.

37939538.review:
To start this game is good and you should enjoy it if you have played the other Turbo Pug games. this game does have some small improvements to be made to make it more enjoyable for longer that i will list under the cons.

Pros:
-This game is like the other Turbo Pug games so if you are a fan of the other games you should enjoy this game as it follows the concept as the other games.
-it does not only have pugs to play as. there are different animals to choose from such as a cat.
-There is a leaderboard that you are able to try to get to the top on and this adds a good challenge to the game.
-it does not take long to unlock the items in the game(took me around 10mins to unlock the first hat)
-The game is easy to get the hang of it. it took me 5mins of playing it took a while to learn the timing of the jumps but after that it was a lot easier and fun.

(just to state that the cons are more just little things that can be fixed in later updates)
Cons:
-Not a lot of things to unlock in the game at this stage as there is only 3 different animals to unlock and 5 different hats to choose from. in future updates i would like to see more items to unlock.
-the way you collect coins in this game can get improved as you dont use the coins to unlock items in the game but its based on the amount of coins you get and when you hit the amount of coins needed to unlock the item it will unlock. To improve i think it would be better for the player to choose what they unlock and not that the game just unlocks it automatically as i think the player should have be able to choose what the coins are spent on.

overall i think this game is worth getting as its a good way to pass the time. The biggest problem for me was that the game did not have a lot of items to unlock and it made the game seem a bit pointless but if they add more things to unlock i would 100% recommend this game to anyone as it will give the player a goal.

36554692.review:
Description:
The conveyor jumping dogs continued to trade and this time the action takes place in 3D. We have the same one-button runner where we need to jump over obstacles one of the proposed cute animals. Our goal will be to get as far as possible and collect as many coins as possible. For coins you can open new animals and headpieces for them. The four biomes, each with their traps and obstacles. Biomes open if to run a certain number of meters without stolknovenii, and a BIOM is available immediately at the next race. Will you be able to get all the achievements and beat the highscore of other players?

Pros:
¥ The ranking of the best players (no cheaters). There is a rate in both daily and for all time.
¥ Interesting to get achievements. If h e had achievements for 1000 points, I would gave up the game much earlier, and so direct his hands were shaking to get the desired achivku.
¥ There were decorations for small animals (hats).
¥ Two mini-games triggered when collecting all the Golden letters scattered locations.

Cons:
¥ Brand for all small animals are missing unique jumps present in previous parts. Differences only in visual terms.
¥ Very often jumps do not work right. And, it seems, had to be jump, but it is not. Had to click a mouse and keyboard.
¥ Rare friezes which for the runner deadly disadvantage.

The result:
I am glad that in the conveyor game, the developers brought something new, and not released a copy of its product with a minimum of changes. Honestly of the four games of the series passed at the moment, the one you like more and despite its disadvantages, only then I felt the pleasure of getting all the achievements. Recommend.

This is an endless runner wherein, unsurprisingly, you play as a pug. You jump on platforms and over obstacles and such. There is a bit of jump lag, and it really hurts the fun the game otherwise offers. This lack of ability to judge when to jump ruins it for me. 

Also, the music is alright, but after it plays a few times in a row, its droning, inescapable happy tone will make your ears bleed.

35038719.review:
This is the dumbest game I've ever played, but I said "I'll uninstall it when I stop laughing whenever my pug hits a spike and gives his death bork" and I still haven't. There's some jump lag that sucks, and there's no depth at all here, but it's the fun kind of stupid and it made me smile.

I would also like to put in a word of praise for the music. There's one track that is like, a power Bollywood rock tune and it's excellent.

Not recommended if you're looking for a real game or endless runner, but definitely recommended if you can find some amusement in this kind of thing.

33260664.review:
I feel like this game has no artistic direction. The 3D graphics really don't work well together. Some elements are voxels (the animals, the flowers, the cubes you jump over, etc) and some are just low-poly shapes (rocks, spikes, etc). Why? They really don't look good when they're next to eachother. The unreal engine should be used to shine those lighting effects on much better graphics than that. They don't have to be high poly, just.. cohesive. Give me a game that doesn't just look like a bunch of assets mashed together. The environement and obstacles are so generic. 

Nothing sets this game apart from other runner games. Turbo Pug DX at least has pretty pixel graphics. And better gameplay. And more variety. Go play that instead.

31045607.review:
If you like Minecraft, and Runner games then this is the game for you! Turbo Pug 3D is a hybrid of both elements stated before, accompanied with a feasible unlock system for new characters and hats through grinding for coins. That alone is surely enough to give a player a “run for their money"!

While there is no plot present in this game, the player’s goal is to achieve the highest score (points). This is if you plan on playing competitively. If not, there are the steam achievements there. This is what I ended up going for.

The graphics and effects are like that you would see in Minecraft. I would add that the effects were too overdone, because they could be distracting and there is no option to minimize or turn them off completely. I found myself dying on parts where it is the most hardest to see the obstacles: Such as the bones in the desert, when it is snowing. That is one aspect that I was displeased at, though I can also see it as another unique factor to challenge players.

The audio and music is suitable for the theme of Turbo Pug 3D. There’s nothing too odd about an 8-bit BGM on a game that solely consists of a block-like environment and textures. 

Overall, it was a nice experience for me, and can be played both casually or competitively for the high score. The tips I would give to players who want to aim for that 1000 points are:
-Focus on your character’s movements and timing of jumps
-Make sure you look ahead a few times, so you can expect certain obstacles
-Try and try again

Good luck. Turbo Pug 3D is a game that I recommend playing!

30497955.review:
(Key received among many from Zaraki Snakenoman.  Thanks, bro!)

[h1]CLICK MEANS JUMP, *SSHOLE!!!![/h1]

This makes the 2nd [i]Turbo Pug[/i] game that I've played and I've come to a simple conclusion...[i]Turbo Pug[/i] is evil!!!

[i]Turbo Pug 3D[/i] is a voxelized (a 3D pixel-version) [i]Turbo Pug[/i] (A runner where you play as a pug with only 1 hitpoint) with an awkward perspective that holds quite a few blindspots and controls that seem to work only when you want them to.  When you want to jump, there will be an occassion where your character does not jump and either lands or collides with obstacles or falls to its death like a lemming.  It doesn't help that the jumping sucks (makes you feel like your character's a rock).

I can appreciate the work that went into this product, but when you're not having any fun, then you can't call this a good game.  If you're an achievement hunter, then you should know that there's an awful distance grind.  Though 1000 does not seem like much in [i]Turbo Pug 3D[/i], you'll find that to be a problem with poor controls.  Though the price is set to $2.00, you'll benefit if the price is approximately $0.50.

1/10  Turrible Pug...

30479258.review:
100% achievements in 4 hours.

I loved this one so much! If you like challenges I consider this a must. The gameplay is very simple, all you have to do is jump (I recommend using space) over obstacles while your pet runs. The graphic style is original, like a Minecraft but with some really good visual effect. The music is not the best but neither the worst, it´s acceptable. Leaderboards to add some replayability once 100%.

I would have never expected so much fun and entertainment for this price. It´s seems so hard at the beginning but before you know it you would be reaching around 400 points and then you are going to be totally addicted and commited to at least reach 1000 to get 100%. The winter landscape is the funniest IMO, challenging!

Totally recommended game. Play it and love it. PUG!

Sí, solamente he jugado 5 minutos. Esos 5 minutos de mi tiempo han sido suficientes para decir lo que es este juego: Una BAZOFIA.
Tengo todos los juegos de Turbo Pug comprados, porque me encanta la saga, por muy estúpida que sea. Pero este juego ya es una basura. Si quieres un Turbo Pug bueno, compra el ''Turbo Pug'' original, ''Super Mega Neo Pug'' o ''Turbo Pug DX'', son sin duda los mejores.
¿Por qué es tan sumamente malo este juego?
1- Requisitos. ¿Me estás diciendo que necesito una 730 para tirar un juego de 1 GB de RAM? Es lamentable tener que tener un PC fuerte para tirar un juego de 1 GB de RAM.
2- Optimización. Voy a 20 FPS, y aunque lo baje todo, nada cambia, parece que sigue igual que antes, hasta peor.
3-El rumbo de esta saga. En Turbo Pug DX ya empezaba a laguearse un poco, y en este ya, la han cagado rotundamente. Me da pena, porque estos juegos a mí me encantaban. Me parece que cuando salga el siguiente, va a ser peor que este y todo

25720664.review:
The best way to describe this silly game would be that Super Mega Neo Pug, Minecraft, and a regular infinite runner like "Temple Run" had a massive orgy and all of their DNA fused together to splurt out this baby -- and it's such a cute baby! 

Like its predecessor, it's a fun time waster. There's no story, no plot, no massive goal -- just jump to stay alive. And jump really is all that you do. Unlike SMNP where you held the button to fly up and released it to drop down, with TP3D you jump. That's it.

The graphics are voxel-based like Minecraft but smooth as silk. If you have a rig that can support it, turning all of the graphics to "epic" gives you an amazing draw distance and gorgeous day/night effects.

My only "complaint" is that Turbo Pug 3D is actually NOT 3D-compatible. (EDIT: Yes, I am FULLY aware that that's not the reason for "3D" in the title.)  I was really hoping to see this in NVIDIA's stereoscopic 3D mode. My heart was set on seeing the distance go w-a-a-a-a-a-a-a-y back into the screen, but - alas! - it doesn't work. Maybe they can work on that for a future update.

Anyway, if you need a fun, silly, and challenging time killer, this game should fit the bill -- for only two dollar bills.

25630771.review:
[h1]An Endless Runner[/h1]
https://youtu.be/tQQsvkTNej8
+ The gameplay is very simple but more fun than you would expect. It's essentially a "1-button game" as you only click or press a key to jump while your character runs for you. It's all about jumping over obstacles and getting as far as you can.
+ I really enjoyed the visual style, reminded me a lot of Minecraft with very blocky / polygonal graphics. I also liked the day/night cycle and the various biomes
+ Very challenging, the game actual requires some pretty precise timed jumpes, and gets progressively harder as you run into harder obstacles.
+ Daily / Global leaderboards help provide replayability
+ Great soundtrack!

- There's an odd filter that makes the game look overly bright at times which I found to be very annoying and a bit bothersome to the eye...especially in a game like this that requires a lot of focus.
- Some obstacles (after about 400points) mainly in the Snow Biome are overly difficult, and feel impossible at times. I wish the game was a tad bit easier to lengthen the expeirence a bit. 

Overall, I enjoyed Turbo Pug 3D a lot more than the original Turbo Pug and find it to be a great improvement.
